page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS II
page.content: { {East Cluden Mill}The mill at East Cluden still retains its internmal shafts and mechanism. Outside are two wheels and the sluice gates.The mill continued in use until 1970 drying grain but is now a dwelling house.The dam is partially repaired. {West Cluden Mill}owners have an ancient right to{Siene net}between Febuary and September which goes with their title deeds. {Killylung Creamery}closed in 1964. Nearby is its old siding and platforms of the now unused Holywood station. The Monaive Railway Line was laid 1904 and was lifted in 1952. {LISTED FARMS.}Two farms with buildings forming a courtyard are listed These are{Nether Gribton and Upper Cluden, the latter also has a circular mill shed.
